name: c14_date
title: Radiocarbon date
description: The uncalibrated date from the laboratory measurement. Should be a conventional 14C date (i.e., 14C yr BP), or a fraction-corrected fraction modern (F14C).  This is typically the 'raw' date reported by the radiocarbon lab in Before Present (BP) notation.

name: c14_date_lab_code
title: Laboratory code for the date determination
description: Unique laboratory identification number which is a combination of a lab identifier prefix, and a number. The prefix should be derived from: https://radiocarbon.webhost.uits.arizona.edu/laboratories.

name: c14_date_sd
title: Radiocarbon date standard deviation
description: The one standard deviation around the 'raw' C14 Date measurement . Must be in the same format (e.g., y BP, or F14C).

name: calib_age_bottom
title: Radiocarbon calibration age lower limit
description: Lower (youngest) range of calibrated age. Calendar timescale to be specified: AD/BC, CE/BCE, cal BP. Note: the abbreviation 'BP' is to be used for uncalibrated 14C determinations, cal BP must be used here.

name: calib_age_prob
title: Radiocarbon calibration age probability
description: Probability of the reported upper and lower calibrated age range, typically in 1 or 2 levels of significance. This is typically specified as 68.2% or 95%, however should be specified.

name: calib_age_upper
title: Radiocarbon calibration age upper limit
description: Upper (oldest) range of calibrated age. Calendar timescale to be specified: AD/BC, CE/BCE, cal BP. The abbreviation BP is to be used for uncalibrated 14C determinations, cal BP must be used here.

name: calib_citation
title: Radiocarbon calibration software citation
description: The DOI, URL or citation information of the publication where the calibration software was originally described.

name: calib_curve
title: Radiocarbon calibration curve name
description: Name of calibration curve used during radiocarbon date calibration.

name: calib_settings
title: Radiocarbon calibration software settings
description: Settings used with the calibration software, including models (where used).

name: calib_software
title: Radiocarbon calibration software
description: The name of the software used to generated the calibrated version of the laboratory measurement date.

name: calib_version
title: Radiocarbon calibration software version
description: Version of the calibration software used for calibration.

name: carb_nitro_ratio
title: carbon/nitrogen ratio
description: Ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen. Used for quality control value in proteinaceous samples for radiocarbon dating.

name: carbon_perc
title: Carbon percentage
description: The percentage of carbon in a non-proteinaceous sample used for dating (such as charcoal), expressed as a percentage (%). Used as a quality control measurement.

name: delta_13_c
title: Delta 13C value
description: The delta carbon-13 value of the sample (δ13C), which is the ratio of the stable isotope 13C to 12C, expressed in per mil (‰) notation. Used as a quality control measurement.

name: delta_13_c_method
title: Delta 13C measurement method
description: Which spectrophotometry method was used to measure the delta carbon-13 value, either with  Isotope Ratio Mass Spectrometer (IRMS) or Accelerated Mass Spectrometer (AMS).

name: reservoir_offset
title: Reservoir offset
description: The offset in years used to modify the calibration curve to account for the marine reservoir effect, if any.

name: reservoir_offset_sd
title: Reservoir offset standard deviation
description: The standard deviation offset in years used to modify the calibration curve to account for the marine reservoir effect, if any.

name: sample_material
title: Radiocarbon dating sample material
description: Material of the sample used to extract carbon used for radiocarbon dating measurements. Use ontology terms where possible, e.g. from UBERON for anatomical parts, or ENVO for other organic samples.
